programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray finds a Gurney Eagle in a garage on Long Island. He wants to put the coveted machine back on the track at Indy to honor Dan Gurney. After intense restoration and scouring the globe for a Gurney-Westlake engine, the Eagle soars again.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray uncovers the infamous “Brawner Hawk” – from the Dean Van Lines team – that became the breakout car in the career of Mario Andretti. Ray enlists HOF mechanic Jim McGee to restore the vehicle and, along the way, discovers a replica with many of the car’s original parts. After an award winning stop at Concours Amelia Island, the car heads to the 100th running of Indy 500 where Mario Andretti himself gets behind the wheel.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Dale Earnhardt Jr. wants Ray to help restore an El Camino, except add on a Laguna front end. It’s not a typical restoration, but it’s certainly a NASCAR performance-worthy restoration. Ray and the team build the car and then, in a bit of gamesmanship, challenge Kyle Tucker, owner of Detroit Speed, to a series of races against his award winning Camaro. But as always, Ray has an ace up his sleeve in Al Unser, Jr. as his driver.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: In the late 60s, Camaros, Mustangs, and Corvettes roared to the forefront of the muscle car world. When Ray gets offered a spot in a vintage race featuring these cars, he’s propelled to dive into their history and afforded a chance to get behind the wheel at the Brickyard. But because it is a pro-am race, Ray pulls in a partner – none other than Bill Elliott, aka “Awesome Bill from Dawsonville.”

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Everyone has a car they fell in love with. Maybe it was the first? Maybe it was the hot rod the guy down the street owned? In Ray’s case, it was the ’58 Chevy he saw in the iconic coming of age car movie, American Graffiti. When Ray gets the chance to own the car after years and years of pursuit, he jumps on it. But restoring the car to its "movie state" proves to be a grueling task that goes way beyond a typical build. But when it's you first love, you can't let her down.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: The premiere episode features a dive into the influence cars had on culture of California. From road racing in the 1940’s to the inception of the iconic Woody wagon on the California beach scene, automobiles undoubtedly shaped the West Coast attitude. Ray talks to The Beach Boys frontman Mike Love and surfing icon Laird Hamilton for a glimpse into the cars that are so connected to surfing culture.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray uncovers the secrets of America’s greatest racing sport in the foothills of North Carolina. When moonshiners were looking to outrun police officers, they would custom fit engines to race the back woods tracks. That sport eventually evolved into NASCAR and Ray talks to the early adopters of this national pastime.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Grammy-winning musician Marty Robbins lived a double life, flawlessly crossing between the glitz of the Grand Ole Opry and track at Talladega. One of few musicians to ever achieve success in both genres, Ray is determined to return Marty’s iconic 777 car to the race track travel back to the 60’s and 70’s.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Legendary drag racer Don “The Snake” Prudhomme proves he is no stranger to the thrill of racing rivalry. Prudhomme’s career and subsequent competition with driver Tom “The Mongoose” McEwan earned the pair an unforgettable imprint on American pop culture. Legions of kids in the 60’s and 70’s flocked to the shelves for Snake and Mongoose Matchbox cars which helped make drag racing an undisputable American pastime. Famed director Ron Howard makes an appearance to discuss the incredible stories hidden within the world of Formula 1 Racing, the topic of his latest, epic feature ‘Rush”.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray finds Buried Treasures in the form of two race cars that had been left almost completely untouched since the last time they were on a race track. One is found sitting in a barn with the other trapped in an old car hauler. Upon uncovering the cars, we find both have big stories to tell.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: A journey to Indianapolis unveils the winning car of the 1955 Indy 500 sits on the roof of an auto mechanic shop. More than 50 years after it’s magic at the track, prominent Indy mechanic/owner Chris Paulsen begins to restore the car and Ray talks about the evolution of America’s illustrious Indy 500.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Smokey Yunick, the most innovative mechanic in NASCAR history, sold his famous truck that hauled equipment & cars across the country. Ray is on a mission to uncover this storied truck that helped launch the beginning of NASCAR’s cross-country popularity.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray travels to Long Island, New York with the hopes of learning more about America’s first major auto racing competition. The race, which began at the turn of the 20th century, helped develop the first major American racing stars and drove American manufacturing to competitive standard with the highly progressive Europeans.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Fred Dmuchowski is a New Jersey racing icon. He was a regular workingman who raced on weekends for fun and became a legend in his iconic 303 racer. Ray works to rebuild the 303 in homage to Fred who inspired him to pursue his career in motorsports.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: Nick Rutter shows you how to fix common issues with your automitve finish

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: Nick Rutter shows you how to remove bugs, polish exhaust tips and safetly remove dust

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Increasing the tire size on your lifted truck might give you better gas mileage, but you end up losing performance. Kevin and Willie show you how gears and tire sizes relate and how to get your power back to the ground.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Want to supercharge your Mustang? Kevin and Willie take a look at the new offering from Pro Charger.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: The guys get a new diagnostic tool in the shop and find a very challenging test for it.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Tri-5 Chevy gets a new exhaust, but only after the guys fix the modified cross-member that just wasn’t cooperating.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Willie B goes on location to experience a two day build school for a Factory Five Roadster.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie swap out performance headers on a Z51 Corvette, showing how not all headers are alike.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Willie shows off the new engine in his ‘67 Barracuda and gets Kevin to help upgrade his wiring and brakes.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: When a 1949 Chevy pick-up shows up at the shop, Kevin and Willie take a look at how far technology has come.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Who better to explain the history and discuss the changes, year to year, of the Dodge Charger, than the Master of Mopar himself, Mark Worman. In this special episode of Graveyard Carz, Mark will show you unique differences, surprising insights, and cool features on multiple years of the same car: the Dodge Charger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The focus has shifted, with parts having arrived at the shop it’s time to install the Grill, Bumper, Dash and Interior of our 1968 Turbine Bronze Charger. Mark and the Ghouls work their magic on the Charger until a familiar face shows up. With Royal there, Mark shifts the crew back to the 1 of 2 1970 Coronet and finishes the interior. Then, it’s time for a test drive!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: With SEMA 2018 looming on the horizon, it’s time to address the elephant in the room. Mark’s 1964 A100 Hemi truck, the Little Dead Wagon, built as an homage to Bill Maverick’s Little Red Wagon. Will is set to prime and paint, but has a disagreement with Mark over the color. When the engine for the A100 shows up it’s time to unbox one of the most powerful engines Graveyard Carz has ever put in a car!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghouls get down to work like never before in order to get the A100 ready for SEMA which is only weeks away. Brakes, suspension, tail lights, bed sealer, you name it and the Mopar Maniacs are racing to get it done. With time flying and stress mounting the team works long hours and weekends trying to finish this iconic build. With SEMA only days away, the A100 finally gets it’s iconic 426 HEMI engine, well, if they can make it fit!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.sub-title: Night of the Little Dead Wagon
programme.desc: There is no time left, SEMA is almost here but the iconic A100 still needs some buttoning up. Installing all of the final components is an all hands on deck task and when the dust settles, Mark has only the decals left to put on the car, completing its legendary look. With the A100 finished the team heads out to SEMA in order to roll the Little Dead Wagon over the red carpet for Mopar and Mark once again receives a very kind gift from our friends.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: When Mark get’s started talking about a car there is almost no stopping him. So it is again when Mark picks multiple years of a favorite Mopar of his and tells both the audience, and whoever will listen all about their amazing options and cool differences. The Ghouls join in on the fun just like last time to pick their favorite things as well. Don’t worry, though, he can’t talk forever right?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: With SEMA over the Ghoulz can finally rest and get back to work on all the cars they had to leave untouched for the last few weeks…again. First up on deck is our beautiful 1972 Duster. Needing its Dash installed as well as its interior there is still a lot of work left on this car! Additionally, metal work has begun on a host of new cars moving up through the shop, it never stops at Graveyard Carz.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: A 1970 Challenger is a special thing, but a B5 Challenger is even more special. With the bumblebee stripe finally added to the car it’s time for the work to really begin. Work begins on all the things that make this 1970 Challenger special, including the headliner, dash, interior and more. With that done it’s time for this beautiful Challenger to get its 440 Six Pack!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The time has finally come. Brett Torino is coming and he is here for his car, the legendary 1 of 2 ever made, 1970 Coronet! Mark wouldn’t be Mark, though, without a few tricks up his sleeve. When Brett arrives to collect on his long restoration from the Mopar Master, the reveal of this truly one of a kind car is done with style. But not before Mark takes us back through the entire restoration leading up to that point. It Is the last 1970 Hemi Coronet Convertible on earth, after all.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The crew is overwhelmed with several restorations at once. From painting stripes, to engine parts, to missing parts on the 71 Charger, tensions are high around the shop. To Make things worse, Mark is obsessed with finding a factory pink Mopar for his granddaughter's 16th birthday.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.sub-title: It's the Great Pumpkin, Mark Worman!
programme.desc: The crew at Graveyard Carz are excited about the pumpkin carving contest, but when a mistake leaves the 'Cuda filled with water, the whole crew has to pay the price. Royal saves the day, but with the carving contest back on the table, where are the pumpkins? Mark has to swallow his pride and accept help from Daren for the contest to go ahead.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Daren is given control of the shop for a week. Darenʼs constant pestering and ribbing leads Mark to hand him the reigns of Graveyard Carz for a week. But instead of getting things done, Daren starts inventing new field trips and distractions for the crew, as well as becoming obsessed with getting his personal Dodge Challenger running again.
